result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Grant D Scaife in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alan Steven Rodriguez appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Solomon H Gatton in court for Alan Steven Rodriguez. 
Defendant was found incompetent, but likely to regain on 19CM949- waiting for a bed in Mendota. Court reviewed Doctors Report(Document 105) on case 19CM949.
Court takes judicial notice over Document 105.
Court finds probable cause. Court finds Deft. is not competent, but likely to regain. Court will not order invol. medication. Court orders Deft. be committed to DHS. 
2 Days credit.
950/Marsy's Law complied with.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
to Seal Victim/ Witness Identification Key
Status conference on June 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property, expect incidental contact at the Detention Center/Sheboygan County Jail

12:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Daniel j Gabler Mr. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alan Steven Rodriguez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by video for Alan Steven Rodriguez. Received complaint/waived reading. Competency is being raised. Probable cause found in the complaint. Bond set.
Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
